Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Environment \En*vi"ron*ment\, n. [Cf. F. environnement.] 1. Act of environing; state of being environed. [1913 Webster]
2. That which environs or surrounds; surrounding conditions, influences, or forces, by which living forms are influenced and modified in their growth and development. [1913 Webster]
It is no friendly environment, this of thine. --Carlyle. [1913 Webster]

environment n 1: the totality of surrounding conditions; "he longed for the comfortable environment of his livingroom" 2: the area in which something exists or lives; "the country--the flat agricultural surround" [syn: {environs}, {surroundings}, {surround}]
